 33 /*global JXG: true, define: true, AMprocessNode: true, MathJax: true, document: true, window: true */

 35 /*
 36     nomen:    Allow underscores to indicate private class members. Might be replaced by local variables.
 37     plusplus: Only allowed in for-loops
 38     newcap:   AsciiMathMl exposes non-constructor functions beginning with upper case letters

 42 /* depends:

 52 
 53 /**
 54  * @fileoverview JSXGraph can use various technologies to render the contents of a construction, e.g.
 55  * SVG, VML, and HTML5 Canvas. To accomplish this, The rendering and the logic and control mechanisms
 56  * are completely separated from each other. Every rendering technology has it's own class, called
 57  * Renderer, e.g. SVGRenderer for SVG, the same for VML and Canvas. The common base for all available
 58  * renderers is the class AbstractRenderer defined in this file.
 59  */
 60 
 61 define([
 62     'jxg', 'options', 'base/coords', 'base/constants', 'math/math', 'math/geometry', 'utils/type', 'utils/env'
 63 ], function (JXG, Options, Coords, Const, Mat, Geometry, Type, Env) {
 64 
 65     "use strict";
 66 
 67     /**
 68      * <p>This class defines the interface to the graphics part of JSXGraph. This class is an abstract class, it
 69      * actually does not render anything. This is up to the {@link JXG.SVGRenderer}, {@link JXG.VMLRenderer},
 70      * and {@link JXG.CanvasRenderer} classes. We strongly discourage you from using the methods in these classes
 71      * directly. Only the methods which are defined in this class and are not marked as private are guaranteed
 72      * to exist in any renderer instance you can access via {@link JXG.Board#renderer}. But not all methods may
 73      * work as expected.</p>
 74      * <p>The methods of this renderer can be divided into different categories:
 75      * <dl>
 76      *     <dt>Draw basic elements</dt>
 77      *     <dd>In this category we find methods to draw basic elements like {@link JXG.Point}, {@link JXG.Line},
 78      *     and {@link JXG.Curve} as well as assisting methods tightly bound to these basic painters. You do not
 79      *     need to implement these methods in a descendant renderer but instead implement the primitive drawing
 80      *     methods described below. This approach is encouraged when you're using a XML based rendering engine
 81      *     like VML and SVG. If you want to use a bitmap based rendering technique you are supposed to override
 82      *     these methods instead of the primitive drawing methods.</dd>
 83      *     <dt>Draw primitives</dt>
 84      *     <dd>This category summarizes methods to handle primitive nodes. As creation and management of these nodes
 85      *     is different among different the rendering techniques most of these methods are purely virtual and need
 86      *     proper implementation if you choose to not overwrite the basic element drawing methods.</dd>
 87      *     <dt>Attribute manipulation</dt>
 88      *     <dd>In XML based renders you have to manipulate XML nodes and their attributes to change the graphics.
 89      *     For that purpose attribute manipulation methods are defined to set the color, opacity, and other things.
 90      *     Please note that some of these methods are required in bitmap based renderers, too, because some elements
 91      *     like {@link JXG.Text} can be HTML nodes floating over the construction.</dd>
 92      *     <dt>Renderer control</dt>
 93      *     <dd>Methods to clear the drawing board or to stop and to resume the rendering engine.</dd>
 94      * </dl></p>
 95      * @class JXG.AbstractRenderer
 96      * @constructor
 97      * @see JXG.SVGRenderer
 98      * @see JXG.VMLRenderer
 99      * @see JXG.CanvasRenderer
100      */
101     JXG.AbstractRenderer = function () {
102 
103         // WHY THIS IS A CLASS INSTEAD OF A SINGLETON OBJECT:
104         //
105         // The renderers need to keep track of some stuff which is not always the same on different boards,
106         // like enhancedRendering, reference to the container object, and resolution in VML. Sure, those
107         // things could be stored in board. But they are rendering related and JXG.Board is already very
108         // very big.
109         //
110         // And we can't save the rendering related data in {SVG,VML,Canvas}Renderer and make only the
111         // JXG.AbstractRenderer a singleton because of that:
112         //
113         // Given an object o with property a set to true
114         //     var o = {a: true};
115         // and a class c doing nothing
116         //     c = function() {};
117         // Set c's prototype to o
118         //     c.prototype = o;
119         // and create an instance of c we get i.a to be true
120         //     i = new c();
121         //     i.a;
122         //     > true
123         // But we can overwrite this property via
124         //     c.prototype.a = false;
125         //     i.a;
126         //     > false
127 
128         /**
129          * The vertical offset for {@link Text} elements. Every {@link Text} element will
130          * be placed this amount of pixels below the user given coordinates.
131          * @type number
132          * @default 8
133          */
134         this.vOffsetText = 0;
135 
136         /**
137          * If this property is set to <tt>true</tt> the visual properties of the elements are updated
138          * on every update. Visual properties means: All the stuff stored in the
139          * {@link JXG.GeometryElement#visProp} property won't be set if enhancedRendering is <tt>false</tt>
140          * @type Boolean
141          * @default true
142          */
143         this.enhancedRendering = true;
144 
145         /**
146          * The HTML element that stores the JSXGraph board in it.
147          * @type Node
148          */
149         this.container = null;
150 
151         /**
152          * This is used to easily determine which renderer we are using
153          * @example if (board.renderer.type === 'vml') {
154           *     // do something
155          * }
156          * @type String
157          */
158         this.type = '';
159 
160         /**
161          * True if the browsers' SVG engine supports foreignObject.
162          * Not supported browsers are IE 9 - 11.
163          * All other browsers return ture, since it is tested with
164          * document.implementation.hasFeature() which is deprecated.
165          *
166          * @type Boolean
167          * @private
168          */
169         this.supportsForeignObject = false;
170 
171     };
172 
173     JXG.extend(JXG.AbstractRenderer.prototype, /** @lends JXG.AbstractRenderer.prototype */ {
174 
175         /* ******************************** *
176          *    private methods               *
177          *    should not be called from     *
178          *    outside AbstractRenderer      *
179          * ******************************** */
180 
181         /**
182          * Update visual properties, but only if {@link JXG.AbstractRenderer#enhancedRendering} or <tt>enhanced</tt> is set to true.
183          * @param {JXG.GeometryElement} element The element to update
184          * @param {Object} [not={}] Select properties you don't want to be updated: <tt>{fill: true, dash: true}</tt> updates
185          * everything except for fill and dash. Possible values are <tt>stroke, fill, dash, shadow, gradient</tt>.
186          * @param {Boolean} [enhanced=false] If true, {@link JXG.AbstractRenderer#enhancedRendering} is assumed to be true.
187          * @private
188          */
189         _updateVisual: function (el, not, enhanced) {
190             if (enhanced || this.enhancedRendering) {
191                 not = not || {};
192 
193                 this.setObjectTransition(el);
194                 if (!Type.evaluate(el.visProp.draft)) {
195                     if (!not.stroke) {
196                         if (el.highlighted) {
197                             this.setObjectStrokeColor(el,
198                                 el.visProp.highlightstrokecolor,
199                                 el.visProp.highlightstrokeopacity);
200                             this.setObjectStrokeWidth(el, el.visProp.highlightstrokewidth);
201                         } else {
202                             this.setObjectStrokeColor(el,
203                                 el.visProp.strokecolor,
204                                 el.visProp.strokeopacity);
205                             this.setObjectStrokeWidth(el, el.visProp.strokewidth);
206                         }
207                     }
208 
209                     if (!not.fill) {
210                         if (el.highlighted) {
211                             this.setObjectFillColor(el,
212                                 el.visProp.highlightfillcolor,
213                                 el.visProp.highlightfillopacity);
214                         } else {
215                             this.setObjectFillColor(el,
216                                 el.visProp.fillcolor,
217                                 el.visProp.fillopacity);
218                         }
219                     }
220 
221                     if (!not.dash) {
222                         this.setDashStyle(el, el.visProp);
223                     }
224 
225                     if (!not.shadow) {
226                         this.setShadow(el);
227                     }
228 
229                     if (!not.gradient) {
230                         this.setShadow(el);
231                     }
232                 } else {
233                     this.setDraft(el);
234                 }
235             }
236         },
237 
238 
239         /* ******************************** *
240          *    Point drawing and updating    *
241          * ******************************** */
242 
243         /**
244          * Draws a point on the {@link JXG.Board}.
245          * @param {JXG.Point} el Reference to a {@link JXG.Point} object that has to be drawn.
246          * @see Point
247          * @see JXG.Point
248          * @see JXG.AbstractRenderer#updatePoint
249          * @see JXG.AbstractRenderer#changePointStyle
250          */
251         drawPoint: function (el) {
252             var prim,
253                 // sometimes el is not a real point and lacks the methods of a JXG.Point instance,
254                 // in these cases to not use el directly.
255                 face = Options.normalizePointFace(Type.evaluate(el.visProp.face));
256 
257             // determine how the point looks like
258             if (face === 'o') {
259                 prim = 'ellipse';
260             } else if (face === '[]') {
261                 prim = 'rect';
262             } else {
263                 // cross/x, diamond/<>, triangleup/a/^, triangledown/v, triangleleft/<,
264                 // triangleright/>, plus/+,
265                 prim = 'path';
266             }
267 
268             el.rendNode = this.appendChildPrim(this.createPrim(prim, el.id), Type.evaluate(el.visProp.layer));
269             this.appendNodesToElement(el, prim);
270 
271             // adjust visual propertys
272             this._updateVisual(el, {dash: true, shadow: true}, true);
273 
274             // By now we only created the xml nodes and set some styles, in updatePoint
275             // the attributes are filled with data.
276             this.updatePoint(el);
277         },
278 
279         /**
280          * Updates visual appearance of the renderer element assigned to the given {@link JXG.Point}.
281          * @param {JXG.Point} el Reference to a {@link JXG.Point} object, that has to be updated.
282          * @see Point
283          * @see JXG.Point
284          * @see JXG.AbstractRenderer#drawPoint
285          * @see JXG.AbstractRenderer#changePointStyle
286          */
287         updatePoint: function (el) {
288             var size = Type.evaluate(el.visProp.size),
289                 // sometimes el is not a real point and lacks the methods of a JXG.Point instance,
290                 // in these cases to not use el directly.
291                 face = Options.normalizePointFace(Type.evaluate(el.visProp.face)),
292                 unit = Type.evaluate(el.visProp.sizeunit),
293                 zoom = Type.evaluate(el.visProp.zoom),
294                 s1;
295 
296             if (!isNaN(el.coords.scrCoords[2] + el.coords.scrCoords[1])) {
297                 if (unit === 'user') {
298                     size *= Math.sqrt(el.board.unitX * el.board.unitY);
299                 }
300                 size *= ((!el.board || !zoom) ?
301                     1.0 : Math.sqrt(el.board.zoomX * el.board.zoomY));
302                 s1 = (size === 0) ? 0 : size + 1;
303 
304                 if (face === 'o') { // circle
305                     this.updateEllipsePrim(el.rendNode, el.coords.scrCoords[1],
306                          el.coords.scrCoords[2], s1, s1);
307                 } else if (face === '[]') { // rectangle
308                     this.updateRectPrim(el.rendNode, el.coords.scrCoords[1] - size,
309                          el.coords.scrCoords[2] - size, size * 2, size * 2);
310                 } else { // x, +, <>, ^, v, <, >
311                     this.updatePathPrim(el.rendNode,
312                         this.updatePathStringPoint(el, size, face), el.board);
313                 }
314                 this._updateVisual(el, {dash: false, shadow: false});
315                 this.setShadow(el);
316             }
317         },
318 
319         /**
320          * Changes the style of a {@link JXG.Point}. This is required because the point styles differ in what
321          * elements have to be drawn, e.g. if the point is marked by a "x" or a "+" two lines are drawn, if
322          * it's marked by spot a circle is drawn. This method removes the old renderer element(s) and creates
323          * the new one(s).
324          * @param {JXG.Point} el Reference to a {@link JXG.Point} object, that's style is changed.
325          * @see Point
326          * @see JXG.Point
327          * @see JXG.AbstractRenderer#updatePoint
328          * @see JXG.AbstractRenderer#drawPoint
329          */
330         changePointStyle: function (el) {
331             var node = this.getElementById(el.id);
332 
333             // remove the existing point rendering node
334             if (Type.exists(node)) {
335                 this.remove(node);
336             }
337 
338             // and make a new one
339             this.drawPoint(el);
340             Type.clearVisPropOld(el);
341 
342             if (!el.visPropCalc.visible) {
343                 this.hide(el);
344             }
345 
346             if (Type.evaluate(el.visProp.draft)) {
347                 this.setDraft(el);
348             }
349         },
350 
351         /* ******************************** *
352          *           Lines                  *
353          * ******************************** */
354 
355         /**
356          * Draws a line on the {@link JXG.Board}.
357          * @param {JXG.Line} el Reference to a line object, that has to be drawn.
358          * @see Line
359          * @see JXG.Line
360          * @see JXG.AbstractRenderer#updateLine
361          */
362         drawLine: function (el) {
363             el.rendNode = this.appendChildPrim(this.createPrim('line', el.id),
364                                     Type.evaluate(el.visProp.layer));
365             this.appendNodesToElement(el, 'lines');
366             this.updateLine(el);
367         },
368 
369         /**
370          * Corrects the line length if there are arrow heads, such that
371          * the arrow ends exactly at the intended position.
372          * Calls the renderer method to draw the line.
373          *
374          * @param {JXG.Line} el Reference to a line object, that has to be drawn.
375          * @param {Number} strokeWidth Stroke width of the line. This determines the size of the
376          *  arrow head.
377          *
378          * @returns {Object} Returns the object returned by
379          *  {@link JXG.AbstractRenderer#getPositionArrowHead}. This contains the information in
380          * horizontal and vertical pixels how much
381          * the line has to be shortened on each end.
382          *
383          * @private
384          * @see Line
385          * @see JXG.Line
386          * @see JXG.AbstractRenderer#updateLine
387          * @see JXG.AbstractRenderer#getPositionArrowHead
388          *
389          */
390         updateLineEndings: function(el, strokewidth) {
391             var c1 = new Coords(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, el.point1.coords.usrCoords, el.board),
392                 c2 = new Coords(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, el.point2.coords.usrCoords, el.board),
393                 obj, margin = null;
394 
395             margin = Type.evaluate(el.visProp.margin);
396             Geometry.calcStraight(el, c1, c2, margin);
397 
398             obj = this.getPositionArrowHead(el, c1, c2, strokewidth);
399             this.updateLinePrim(el.rendNode,
400                 obj.c1.scrCoords[1] + obj.d1x, obj.c1.scrCoords[2] + obj.d1y,
401                 obj.c2.scrCoords[1] - obj.d2x, obj.c2.scrCoords[2] - obj.d2y, el.board);
402 
403             return obj;
404         },
405 
406         /**
407          * Read the attribute "size" of the arrow heads. Multiplied with the stroke width of the line
408          * this gives the absolute size of the arrow heads. Then the arrow heads are redrawn by the renderer.
409          *
410          * @param {JXG.Line} el Reference to a line object, that has to be drawn.
411          * @param {Object} obj Reference to a object returned by
412          *     {@link JXG.AbstractRenderer#getPositionArrowHead}
413          * @returns {JXG.AbstractRenderer} Reference to the renderer
414          *
415          * @private
416          * @see Line
417          * @see JXG.Line
418          * @see JXG.AbstractRenderer#updateLine
419          * @see JXG.AbstractRenderer#getPositionArrowHead
420          */
421         updateArrowSize: function(el, obj) {
422             var size, ev_fa, ev_la;
423 
424             ev_fa = Type.evaluate(el.visProp.firstarrow);
425             if (ev_fa) {
426                 if (Type.exists(ev_fa.size)) {
427                     size = Type.evaluate(ev_fa.size);
428                 } else {
429                     size = 3;
430                 }
431 
432                 this._setArrowWidth(el.rendNodeTriangleStart,  obj.sFirst, el.rendNode, size);
433             }
434             ev_la = Type.evaluate(el.visProp.lastarrow);
435             if (ev_la) {
436                 if (Type.exists(ev_la.size)) {
437                     size = Type.evaluate(ev_la.size);
438                 } else {
439                     size = 3;
440                 }
441                 this._setArrowWidth(el.rendNodeTriangleEnd, obj.sLast, el.rendNode, size);
442             }
443 
444             return this;
445         },
446 
447         /**
448          * Updates visual appearance of the renderer element assigned to the given {@link JXG.Line}.
449          * @param {JXG.Line} el Reference to the {@link JXG.Line} object that has to be updated.
450          * @see Line
451          * @see JXG.Line
452          * @see JXG.AbstractRenderer#drawLine
453          */
454         updateLine: function (el) {
455             var obj;
456 
457             obj = this.updateLineEndings(el, Type.evaluate(el.visProp.strokewidth));
458             this.makeArrows(el);
459             this._updateVisual(el);
460             this.updateArrowSize(el, obj);
461             this.setLineCap(el);
462         },
463 
464         /**
465          * Shorten the line length such that the arrow head touches
466          * the start or end point and such that the arrow head ends exactly
467          * at the start / end position of the line.
468          *
469          * @param  {JXG.Line} el Reference to the line object that gets arrow heads.
470          * @param  {JXG.Coords} c1   Coords of the first point of the line (after {@link JXG.Geometry#calcStraight}).
471          * @param  {JXG.Coords} c2  Coords of the second point of the line (after {@link JXG.Geometry#calcStraight}).
472          * @return {object}        Object containing how much the line has to be shortened.
473          * Data structure: {d1x, d1y, d2x, d2y, sFirst, sLast}. sFirst and sLast is the length by which
474          * firstArrow and lastArrow have to shifted such that there is no gap between arrow head and line.
475          * Additionally, if one of these values is zero, the arrow is not displayed. This is the case, if the
476          * line length is very short.
477          */
478         getPositionArrowHead: function(el, c1, c2, strokewidth) {
479             var s, s1, s2, d, d1x, d1y, d2x, d2y,
480                 minlen = Mat.eps,
481                 typeFirst, typeLast,
482                 sFirst = 0,
483                 sLast = 0,
484                 ev_fa = Type.evaluate(el.visProp.firstarrow),
485                 ev_la = Type.evaluate(el.visProp.lastarrow),
486                 size;
487 
488             d1x = d1y = d2x = d2y = 0.0;
489             /*
490                Handle arrow heads.
491 
492                The arrow head is an isosceles triangle with base length 10 units and height 10 units.
493                These 10 units are scaled to strokeWidth * arrowSize pixels pixels.
494             */
495             if (ev_fa || ev_la) {
496                 s1 = Type.evaluate(el.point1.visProp.size) + Type.evaluate(el.point1.visProp.strokewidth);
497                 s2 = Type.evaluate(el.point2.visProp.size) + Type.evaluate(el.point2.visProp.strokewidth);
498                 s = s1 + s2;
499 
500                 // Handle touchlastpoint /touchfirstpoint
501                 if (ev_la && Type.evaluate(el.visProp.touchlastpoint)) {
502                     d = c1.distance(Const.COORDS_BY_SCREEN, c2);
503                     if (d > s) {
504                         d2x = (c2.scrCoords[1] - c1.scrCoords[1]) * s2 / d;
505                         d2y = (c2.scrCoords[2] - c1.scrCoords[2]) * s2 / d;
506                         c2 = new Coords(Const.COORDS_BY_SCREEN, [c2.scrCoords[1] - d2x, c2.scrCoords[2] - d2y], el.board);
507                     }
508                 }
509                 if (ev_fa && Type.evaluate(el.visProp.touchfirstpoint)) {
510                     d = c1.distance(Const.COORDS_BY_SCREEN, c2);
511                     if (d > s) {
512                         d1x = (c2.scrCoords[1] - c1.scrCoords[1]) * s1 / d;
513                         d1y = (c2.scrCoords[2] - c1.scrCoords[2]) * s1 / d;
514                         c1 = new Coords(Const.COORDS_BY_SCREEN, [c1.scrCoords[1] + d1x, c1.scrCoords[2] + d1y], el.board);
515                     }
516                 }
517 
518                 // Correct the position of the arrow heads
519                 d1x = d1y = d2x = d2y = 0.0;
520                 d = c1.distance(Const.COORDS_BY_SCREEN, c2);
521 
522                 if (Type.exists(ev_fa.type)) {
523                     typeFirst = Type.evaluate(ev_fa.type);
524                 }
525                 if (Type.exists(ev_la.type)) {
526                     typeLast = Type.evaluate(ev_la.type);
527                 }
528 
529                 if (ev_fa) {
530                     if (Type.exists(ev_fa.size)) {
531                         size = Type.evaluate(ev_fa.size);
532                     } else {
533                         size = 3;
534                     }
535                     sFirst = strokewidth * size;
536                     if (typeFirst === 2) {
537                         sFirst *= 0.5;
538                         minlen += strokewidth * size;
539                     } else if (typeFirst === 3) {
540                         sFirst = strokewidth;
541                         minlen += strokewidth;
542                     } else {
543                         minlen += strokewidth * size;
544                     }
545                 }
546                 if (ev_la) {
547                     if (Type.exists(ev_la.size)) {
548                         size = Type.evaluate(ev_la.size);
549                     } else {
550                         size = 3;
551                     }
552                     sLast = strokewidth * size;
553                     if (typeLast === 2) {
554                         sLast *= 0.5;
555                         minlen += strokewidth * size;
556                     } else if (typeLast === 3) {
557                         sLast = strokewidth;
558                         minlen += strokewidth;
559                     } else {
560                         minlen += strokewidth * size;
561                     }
562                 }
563 
564                 if (ev_fa &&
565                     el.board.renderer.type !== 'vml') {
566                     if (d >= minlen) {
567                         d1x = (c2.scrCoords[1] - c1.scrCoords[1]) * sFirst / d;
568                         d1y = (c2.scrCoords[2] - c1.scrCoords[2]) * sFirst / d;
569                     } else {
570                         sFirst = 0;
571                     }
572                 }
573 
574                 if (ev_la &&
575                     el.board.renderer.type !== 'vml') {
576 
577                     if (d >= minlen) {
578                         d2x = (c2.scrCoords[1] - c1.scrCoords[1]) * sLast / d;
579                         d2y = (c2.scrCoords[2] - c1.scrCoords[2]) * sLast / d;
580                     } else {
581                         sLast = 0.0;
582                     }
583                 }
584             }
585 
586             return {
587                 c1: c1,
588                 c2: c2,
589                 d1x: d1x,
590                 d1y: d1y,
591                 d2x: d2x,
592                 d2y: d2y,
593                 sFirst: sFirst,
594                 sLast: sLast
595             };
596         },
597 
598         /**
599          * Update the line endings (linecap) of a straight line from its attribute
600          * 'linecap'.
601          * Possible values for the attribute 'linecap' are: 'butt', 'round', 'square'.
602          * The default value is 'butt'. Not available for VML renderer.
603          *
604          * @param {JXG.Line} element A arbitrary line.
605          * @see Line
606          * @see JXG.Line
607          * @see JXG.AbstractRenderer#updateLine
608          */
609         setLineCap: function(el) { /* stub */ },
610 
611         /**
612          * Creates a rendering node for ticks added to a line.
613          * @param {JXG.Line} el A arbitrary line.
614          * @see Line
615          * @see Ticks
616          * @see JXG.Line
617          * @see JXG.Ticks
618          * @see JXG.AbstractRenderer#updateTicks
619          */
620         drawTicks: function (el) {
621             el.rendNode = this.appendChildPrim(this.createPrim('path', el.id), Type.evaluate(el.visProp.layer));
622             this.appendNodesToElement(el, 'path');
623         },
624 
625         /**
626          * Update {@link Ticks} on a {@link JXG.Line}. This method is only a stub and has to be implemented
627          * in any descendant renderer class.

629          * @see Line
630          * @see Ticks
631          * @see JXG.Line
632          * @see JXG.Ticks
633          * @see JXG.AbstractRenderer#drawTicks
634          */
635         updateTicks: function (element) { /* stub */ },
636 
637         /* **************************
638          *    Curves
639          * **************************/
640 
641         /**
642          * Draws a {@link JXG.Curve} on the {@link JXG.Board}.
643          * @param {JXG.Curve} el Reference to a graph object, that has to be plotted.
644          * @see Curve
645          * @see JXG.Curve
646          * @see JXG.AbstractRenderer#updateCurve
647          */
648         drawCurve: function (el) {
649             el.rendNode = this.appendChildPrim(this.createPrim('path', el.id), Type.evaluate(el.visProp.layer));
650             this.appendNodesToElement(el, 'path');
651             if (el.numberPoints > 1) {
652                 this.makeArrows(el);
653             }
654             this._updateVisual(el, {shadow: true}, true);
655             this.updateCurve(el);
656         },
657 
658         /**
659          * Updates visual appearance of the renderer element assigned to the given {@link JXG.Curve}.
660          * @param {JXG.Curve} el Reference to a {@link JXG.Curve} object, that has to be updated.
661          * @see Curve
662          * @see JXG.Curve
663          * @see JXG.AbstractRenderer#drawCurve
664          */
665         updateCurve: function (el) {
666             var w = Type.evaluate(el.visProp.strokewidth),
667                 size, ev_fa, ev_la;
668 
669             if (Type.evaluate(el.visProp.handdrawing)) {
670                 this.updatePathPrim(el.rendNode, this.updatePathStringBezierPrim(el), el.board);
671             } else {
672                 this.updatePathPrim(el.rendNode, this.updatePathStringPrim(el), el.board);
673             }
674 
675             if (el.numberPoints > 1) {
676                 this.makeArrows(el);
677 
678                 ev_fa = Type.evaluate(el.visProp.firstarrow);
679                 if (ev_fa) {
680                     if (Type.exists(ev_fa.size)) {
681                         size = Type.evaluate(ev_fa.size);
682                     } else {
683                         size = 3;
684                     }
685 
686                     this._setArrowWidth(el.rendNodeTriangleStart, w, el.rendNode, size);
687                 }
688                 ev_la = Type.evaluate(el.visProp.lastarrow);
689                 if (ev_la) {
690                     if (Type.exists(ev_la.size)) {
691                         size = Type.evaluate(ev_la.size);
692                     } else {
693                         size = 3;
694                     }
695                     this._setArrowWidth(el.rendNodeTriangleEnd, w, el.rendNode, size);
696                 }
697             }
698             this._updateVisual(el);
699 
700         },
701 
702         /* **************************
703          *    Circle related stuff
704          * **************************/
705 
706         /**
707          * Draws a {@link JXG.Circle}
708          * @param {JXG.Circle} el Reference to a {@link JXG.Circle} object that has to be drawn.
709          * @see Circle
710          * @see JXG.Circle
711          * @see JXG.AbstractRenderer#updateEllipse
712          */
713         drawEllipse: function (el) {
714             el.rendNode = this.appendChildPrim(this.createPrim('ellipse', el.id),
715                                     Type.evaluate(el.visProp.layer));
716             this.appendNodesToElement(el, 'ellipse');
717             this.updateEllipse(el);
718         },
719 
720         /**
721          * Updates visual appearance of a given {@link JXG.Circle} on the {@link JXG.Board}.
722          * @param {JXG.Circle} el Reference to a {@link JXG.Circle} object, that has to be updated.
723          * @see Circle
724          * @see JXG.Circle
725          * @see JXG.AbstractRenderer#drawEllipse
726          */
727         updateEllipse: function (el) {
728             this._updateVisual(el);
729 
730             var radius = el.Radius();
731 
732             if (radius > 0.0 &&
733                     Math.abs(el.center.coords.usrCoords[0]) > Mat.eps &&
734                     !isNaN(radius + el.center.coords.scrCoords[1] + el.center.coords.scrCoords[2]) &&
735                     radius * el.board.unitX < 2000000) {
736                 this.updateEllipsePrim(el.rendNode, el.center.coords.scrCoords[1],
737                     el.center.coords.scrCoords[2],
738                     (radius * el.board.unitX),
739                     (radius * el.board.unitY));
740             }
741         },
742 
743

745          *   Polygon related stuff
746          * **************************/

752          * @see JXG.Polygon
753          * @see JXG.AbstractRenderer#updatePolygon

762         /**
763          * Updates properties of a {@link JXG.Polygon}'s rendering node.
764          * @param {JXG.Polygon} el Reference to a {@link JXG.Polygon} object, that has to be updated.
765          * @see Polygon
766          * @see JXG.Polygon
767          * @see JXG.AbstractRenderer#drawPolygon
768          */
769         updatePolygon: function (el) {
770             // Here originally strokecolor wasn't updated but strokewidth was
771             // but if there's no strokecolor i don't see why we should update strokewidth.
772             this._updateVisual(el, {stroke: true, dash: true});
773             this.updatePolygonPrim(el.rendNode, el);
774         },

780         /**
781          * Shows a small copyright notice in the top left corner of the board.
782          * @param {String} str The copyright notice itself
783          * @param {Number} fontsize Size of the font the copyright notice is written in
784          */
785         displayCopyright: function (str, fontsize) { /* stub */ },
786 
787         /**
788          * An internal text is a {@link JXG.Text} element which is drawn using only
789          * the given renderer but no HTML. This method is only a stub, the drawing
790          * is done in the special renderers.
791          * @param {JXG.Text} element Reference to a {@link JXG.Text} object
792          * @see Text
793          * @see JXG.Text
794          * @see JXG.AbstractRenderer#updateInternalText
795          * @see JXG.AbstractRenderer#drawText
796          * @see JXG.AbstractRenderer#updateText
797          * @see JXG.AbstractRenderer#updateTextStyle
798          */
799         drawInternalText: function (element) { /* stub */ },
800 
801         /**
802          * Updates visual properties of an already existing {@link JXG.Text} element.
803          * @param {JXG.Text} element Reference to an {@link JXG.Text} object, that has to be updated.
804          * @see Text
805          * @see JXG.Text
806          * @see JXG.AbstractRenderer#drawInternalText
807          * @see JXG.AbstractRenderer#drawText
808          * @see JXG.AbstractRenderer#updateText
809          * @see JXG.AbstractRenderer#updateTextStyle
810          */
811         updateInternalText: function (element) { /* stub */ },
812 
813         /**
814          * Displays a {@link JXG.Text} on the {@link JXG.Board} by putting a HTML div over it.
815          * @param {JXG.Text} el Reference to an {@link JXG.Text} object, that has to be displayed
816          * @see Text
817          * @see JXG.Text
818          * @see JXG.AbstractRenderer#drawInternalText
819          * @see JXG.AbstractRenderer#updateText
820          * @see JXG.AbstractRenderer#updateInternalText
821          * @see JXG.AbstractRenderer#updateTextStyle
822          */
823         drawText: function (el) {
824             var node, z, level;
825 
826             if (Type.evaluate(el.visProp.display) === 'html' && Env.isBrowser && this.type !== 'no') {
827                 node = this.container.ownerDocument.createElement('div');
828                 //node = this.container.ownerDocument.createElementNS('http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml', 'div'); //
829                 node.style.position = 'absolute';
830                 node.className = Type.evaluate(el.visProp.cssclass);
831 
832                 level = Type.evaluate(el.visProp.layer);
833                 if (!Type.exists(level)) { // trace nodes have level not set
834                     level = 0;
835                 }
836 
837                 if (this.container.style.zIndex === '') {
838                     z = 0;
839                 } else {
840                     z = parseInt(this.container.style.zIndex, 10);
841                 }
842 
843                 node.style.zIndex = z + level;
844                 this.container.appendChild(node);
845 
846                 node.setAttribute('id', this.container.id + '_' + el.id);
847             } else {
848                 node = this.drawInternalText(el);
849             }
850 
851             el.rendNode = node;
852             el.htmlStr = '';
853             this.updateText(el);
854         },
855 
856         /**
857          * Updates visual properties of an already existing {@link JXG.Text} element.
858          * @param {JXG.Text} el Reference to an {@link JXG.Text} object, that has to be updated.
859          * @see Text
860          * @see JXG.Text
861          * @see JXG.AbstractRenderer#drawText
862          * @see JXG.AbstractRenderer#drawInternalText
863          * @see JXG.AbstractRenderer#updateInternalText
864          * @see JXG.AbstractRenderer#updateTextStyle
865          */
866         updateText: function (el) {
867             var content = el.plaintext, v, c,
868                 parentNode,
869                 ax, ay;
870 
871             if (el.visPropCalc.visible) {
872                 this.updateTextStyle(el, false);
873 
874                 if (Type.evaluate(el.visProp.display) === 'html' && this.type !== 'no') {
875                     // Set the position
876                     if (!isNaN(el.coords.scrCoords[1] + el.coords.scrCoords[2])) {
877 
878                         // Horizontal
879                         c = el.coords.scrCoords[1];
880                         // webkit seems to fail for extremely large values for c.
881                         c = Math.abs(c) < 1000000 ? c : 1000000;
882                         ax = el.getAnchorX();
883 
884                         if (ax === 'right') {
885                             v = Math.floor(el.board.canvasWidth - c);
886                         } else if (ax === 'middle') {
887                             v = Math.floor(c - 0.5 * el.size[0]);
888                         } else { // 'left'
889                             v = Math.floor(c);
890                         }
891 
892                         // This may be useful for foreignObj.
893                         //if (window.devicePixelRatio !== undefined) {
894                         //v *= window.devicePixelRatio;
895                         //}
896 
897                         if (el.visPropOld.left !== (ax + v)) {
898                             if (ax === 'right') {
899                                 el.rendNode.style.right = v + 'px';
900                                 el.rendNode.style.left = 'auto';
901                             } else {
902                                 el.rendNode.style.left = v + 'px';
903                                 el.rendNode.style.right = 'auto';
904                             }
905                             el.visPropOld.left = ax + v;
906                         }
907 
908                         // Vertical
909                         c = el.coords.scrCoords[2] + this.vOffsetText;
910                         c = Math.abs(c) < 1000000 ? c : 1000000;
911                         ay = el.getAnchorY();
912 
913                         if (ay === 'bottom') {
914                             v = Math.floor(el.board.canvasHeight - c);
915                         } else if (ay === 'middle') {
916                             v = Math.floor(c - 0.5 * el.size[1]);
917                         } else { // top
918                             v = Math.floor(c);
919                         }
920 
921                         // This may be useful for foreignObj.
922                         //if (window.devicePixelRatio !== undefined) {
923                         //v *= window.devicePixelRatio;
924                         //}
925 
926                         if (el.visPropOld.top !== (ay + v)) {
927                             if (ay === 'bottom') {
928                                 el.rendNode.style.top = 'auto';
929                                 el.rendNode.style.bottom = v + 'px';
930                             } else {
931                                 el.rendNode.style.bottom = 'auto';
932                                 el.rendNode.style.top = v + 'px';
933                             }
934                             el.visPropOld.top = ay + v;
935                         }
936                     }
937 
938                     // Set the content
939                     if (el.htmlStr !== content) {
940                         try {
941                             el.rendNode.innerHTML = content;
942                         } catch (e) {
943                             // Setting innerHTML sometimes fails in IE8. A workaround is to
944                             // take the node off the DOM, assign innerHTML, then append back.
945                             // Works for text elements as they are absolutely positioned.
946                             parentNode = el.rendNode.parentNode;
947                             el.rendNode.parentNode.removeChild(el.rendNode);
948                             el.rendNode.innerHTML = content;
949                             parentNode.appendChild(el.rendNode);
950                         }
951                         el.htmlStr = content;
952 
953                         if (Type.evaluate(el.visProp.usemathjax)) {
954                             // typesetting directly might not work because mathjax was not loaded completely
955                             // see http://www.mathjax.org/docs/1.1/typeset.html
956                             try {
957                                 MathJax.Hub.Queue(['Typeset', MathJax.Hub, el.rendNode]);
958                             } catch (e) {
959                                 JXG.debug('MathJax (not yet) loaded');
960                             }
961                         } else if (Type.evaluate(el.visProp.useasciimathml)) {
962                             // This is not a constructor.
963                             // See http://www1.chapman.edu/~jipsen/mathml/asciimath.html for more information
964                             // about AsciiMathML and the project's source code.
965                             try {
966                                 AMprocessNode(el.rendNode, false);
967                             } catch (e) {
968                                 JXG.debug('AsciiMathML (not yet) loaded');
969                             }
970                         }
971                     }
972                     this.transformImage(el, el.transformations);
973                 } else {
974                     this.updateInternalText(el);
975                 }
976             }
977         },
978 
979         /**
980          * Converts string containing CSS properties into
981          * array with key-value pair objects.
982          *
983          * @example
984          * "color:blue; background-color:yellow" is converted to
985          * [{'color': 'blue'}, {'backgroundColor': 'yellow'}]
986          *
987          * @param  {String} cssString String containing CSS properties
988          * @return {Array}           Array of CSS key-value pairs
989          */
990         _css2js: function(cssString) {
991             var pairs = [],
992                 i, len, key, val, s,
993                 list = Type.trim(cssString).replace(/;$/, '').split(";");
994 
995             len = list.length;
996             for (i = 0; i < len; ++i) {
997                 if (Type.trim(list[i]) !== '') {
998                     s = list[i].split(':');
999                     key = Type.trim(s[0].replace(/-([a-z])/gi, function(match, char) { return char.toUpperCase(); }));
1000                     val = Type.trim(s[1]);
1001                     pairs.push({'key': key, 'val': val});
1002                 }
1003             }
1004             return pairs;
1005 
1006         },
1007 
1008         /**
1009          * Updates font-size, color and opacity propertiey and CSS style properties of a {@link JXG.Text} node.
1010          * This function is also called by highlight() and nohighlight().
1011          * @param {JXG.Text} el Reference to the {@link JXG.Text} object, that has to be updated.
1012          * @param {Boolean} doHighlight
1013          * @see Text
1014          * @see JXG.Text
1015          * @see JXG.AbstractRenderer#drawText
1016          * @see JXG.AbstractRenderer#drawInternalText
1017          * @see JXG.AbstractRenderer#updateText
1018          * @see JXG.AbstractRenderer#updateInternalText
1019          * @see JXG.AbstractRenderer#updateInternalTextStyle
1020          */
1021         updateTextStyle: function (el, doHighlight) {
1022             var fs, so, sc, css, node,
1023                 ev = el.visProp,
1024                 display = Env.isBrowser ? ev.display : 'internal',
1025                 nodeList = ['rendNode', 'rendNodeTag', 'rendNodeLabel'],
1026                 lenN = nodeList.length,
1027                 cssList, prop, style, cssString,
1028                 styleList = ['cssdefaultstyle', 'cssstyle'],
1029                 lenS = styleList.length;
1030 
1031             if (doHighlight) {
1032                 sc = ev.highlightstrokecolor;
1033                 so = ev.highlightstrokeopacity;
1034                 css = ev.highlightcssclass;
1035             } else {
1036                 sc = ev.strokecolor;
1037                 so = ev.strokeopacity;
1038                 css = ev.cssclass;
1039             }
1040 
1041             // This part is executed for all text elements except internal texts in canvas.
1042             // HTML-texts or internal texts in SVG or VML.
1043             //            HTML    internal
1044             //  SVG        +         +
1045             //  VML        +         +
1046             //  canvas     +         -
1047             //  no         -         -
1048             if ((this.type !== 'no') &&
1049                 (display === 'html' || this.type !== 'canvas')
1050                ) {
1051                 for (style = 0; style < lenS; style++) {
1052                     // First set cssString to
1053                     // ev.cssdefaultstyle of ev.highlightcssdefaultstyle,
1054                     // then to
1055                     // ev.cssstyle of ev.highlightcssstyle
1056                     cssString = Type.evaluate(ev[(doHighlight ? 'highlight' : '') + styleList[style]]);
1057                     if (cssString !== '' &&
1058                         el.visPropOld[styleList[style]] !== cssString) {
1059                         cssList = this._css2js(cssString);
1060                         for (node = 0; node < lenN; node++) {
1061                             if (Type.exists(el[nodeList[node]])) {
1062                                 for (prop in cssList) {
1063                                     if (cssList.hasOwnProperty(prop)) {
1064                                         el[nodeList[node]].style[cssList[prop].key] = cssList[prop].val;
1065                                     }
1066                                 }
1067                             }
1068                         }
1069                         el.visPropOld[styleList[style]] = cssString;
1070                     }
1071                 }
1072 
1073                 fs = Type.evaluate(ev.fontsize);
1074                 if (el.visPropOld.fontsize !== fs) {
1075                     el.needsSizeUpdate = true;
1076                     try {
1077                         for (node = 0; node < lenN; node++) {
1078                             if (Type.exists(el[nodeList[node]])) {
1079                                 el[nodeList[node]].style.fontSize = fs + 'px';
1080                             }
1081                         }
1082                     } catch (e) {
1083                         // IE needs special treatment.
1084                         for (node = 0; node < lenN; node++) {
1085                             if (Type.exists(el[nodeList[node]])) {
1086                                 el[nodeList[node]].style.fontSize = fs;
1087                             }
1088                         }
1089                     }
1090                     el.visPropOld.fontsize = fs;
1091                 }
1092             }
1093 
1094             this.setObjectTransition(el);
1095             if (display === 'html' && this.type !== 'no') {
1096                 // Set new CSS class
1097                 if (el.visPropOld.cssclass !== css) {
1098                     el.rendNode.className = css;
1099                     el.visPropOld.cssclass = css;
1100                     el.needsSizeUpdate = true;
1101                 }
1102                 this.setObjectStrokeColor(el, sc, so);
1103             } else {
1104                 this.updateInternalTextStyle(el, sc, so);
1105             }
1106 
1107             return this;
1108         },
1109 
1110         /**
1111          * Set color and opacity of internal texts.
1112          * This method is used for Canvas and VML.
1113          * SVG needs its own version.
1114          * @private
1115          * @see JXG.AbstractRenderer#updateTextStyle
1116          * @see JXG.SVGRenderer#updateInternalTextStyle
1117          */
1118         updateInternalTextStyle: function (el, strokeColor, strokeOpacity) {
1119             this.setObjectStrokeColor(el, strokeColor, strokeOpacity);
1120         },
1121 
1122         /* **************************
1123          *    Image related stuff
1124          * **************************/
1125 
1126         /**
1127          * Draws an {@link JXG.Image} on a board; This is just a template that has to be implemented by special
1128          * renderers.
1129          * @param {JXG.Image} element Reference to the image object that is to be drawn
1130          * @see Image
1131          * @see JXG.Image
1132          * @see JXG.AbstractRenderer#updateImage
1133          */
1134         drawImage: function (element) { /* stub */ },
1135 
1136         /**
1137          * Updates the properties of an {@link JXG.Image} element.
1138          * @param {JXG.Image} el Reference to an {@link JXG.Image} object, that has to be updated.
1139          * @see Image
1140          * @see JXG.Image
1141          * @see JXG.AbstractRenderer#drawImage
1142          */
1143         updateImage: function (el) {
1144             this.updateRectPrim(el.rendNode, el.coords.scrCoords[1],
1145                 el.coords.scrCoords[2] - el.size[1], el.size[0], el.size[1]);
1146 
1147             this.updateImageURL(el);
1148             this.transformImage(el, el.transformations);
1149             this._updateVisual(el, {stroke: true, dash: true}, true);
1150         },
1151 
1152         /**
1153          * Multiplication of transformations without updating. That means, at that point it is expected that the
1154          * matrices contain numbers only. First, the origin in user coords is translated to <tt>(0,0)</tt> in screen
1155          * coords. Then, the stretch factors are divided out. After the transformations in user coords, the stretch
1156          * factors are multiplied in again, and the origin in user coords is translated back to its position. This
1157          * method does not have to be implemented in a new renderer.
1158          * @param {JXG.GeometryElement} el A JSXGraph element. We only need its board property.
1159          * @param {Array} transformations An array of JXG.Transformations.
1160          * @returns {Array} A matrix represented by a two dimensional array of numbers.
1161          * @see JXG.AbstractRenderer#transformImage
1162          */
1163         joinTransforms: function (el, transformations) {
1164             var i,
1165                 ox = el.board.origin.scrCoords[1],
1166                 oy = el.board.origin.scrCoords[2],
1167                 ux = el.board.unitX,
1168                 uy = el.board.unitY,
1169                 // Translate to 0,0 in screen coords
1170                 /*
1171                 m = [[1, 0, 0], [0, 1, 0], [0, 0, 1]],
1172                 mpre1 =  [[1,   0, 0],
1173                     [-ox, 1, 0],
1174                     [-oy, 0, 1]],
1175                 // Scale
1176                 mpre2 =  [[1, 0,     0],
1177                     [0, 1 / ux,  0],
1178                     [0, 0, -1 / uy]],
1179                 // Scale back
1180                 mpost2 = [[1, 0,   0],
1181                     [0, ux,  0],
1182                     [0, 0, -uy]],
1183                 // Translate back
1184                 mpost1 = [[1,  0, 0],
1185                     [ox, 1, 0],
1186                     [oy, 0, 1]],
1187                 */
1188                 len = transformations.length,
1189                 // Translate to 0,0 in screen coords and then scale
1190                 m = [[1,        0,       0],
1191                      [-ox / ux, 1 / ux,  0],
1192                      [ oy / uy, 0, -1 / uy]];
1193 
1194             for (i = 0; i < len; i++) {
1195                 //m = Mat.matMatMult(mpre1, m);
1196                 //m = Mat.matMatMult(mpre2, m);
1197                 m = Mat.matMatMult(transformations[i].matrix, m);
1198                 //m = Mat.matMatMult(mpost2, m);
1199                 //m = Mat.matMatMult(mpost1, m);
1200             }
1201             // Scale back and then translate back
1202             m = Mat.matMatMult([[1,   0, 0],
1203                                 [ox, ux, 0],
1204                                 [oy,  0, -uy]], m);
1205             return m;
1206         },
1207 
1208         /**
1209          * Applies transformations on images and text elements. This method is just a stub and has to be implemented in
1210          * all descendant classes where text and image transformations are to be supported.
1211          * @param {JXG.Image|JXG.Text} element A {@link JXG.Image} or {@link JXG.Text} object.
1212          * @param {Array} transformations An array of {@link JXG.Transformation} objects. This is usually the
1213          * transformations property of the given element <tt>el</tt>.
1214          */
1215         transformImage: function (element, transformations) { /* stub */ },

1229          * It does not work for Canvas.
1230          * SVGRenderer overwrites this method.
1231          * @param {JXG.Text} el Reference to the {@link JXG.Image} object, that has to be updated.
1232          * @param {Boolean} doHighlight
1233          * @see Image
1234          * @see JXG.Image
1235          * @see JXG.AbstractRenderer#highlight
1236          * @see JXG.AbstractRenderer#noHighlight
1237          */
1238         updateImageStyle: function (el, doHighlight) {
1239             el.rendNode.className = Type.evaluate(doHighlight ? el.visProp.highlightcssclass : el.visProp.cssclass);
1240         },

1420         /**
1421          * Sets the buffering as recommended by SVGWG. Until now only Opera supports this and will be ignored by other
1422          * browsers. Although this feature is only supported by SVG we have this method in {@link JXG.AbstractRenderer}
1423          * because it is called from outside the renderer.
1424          * @param {Node} node The SVG DOM Node which buffering type to update.
1425          * @param {String} type Either 'auto', 'dynamic', or 'static'. For an explanation see
1426          *   {@link http://www.w3.org/TR/SVGTiny12/painting.html#BufferedRenderingProperty}.

1428         setBuffering: function (node, type) { /* stub */ },

1430         /**
1431          * Sets an element's dash style.
1432          * @param {JXG.GeometryElement} element An JSXGraph element.
1433          */
1434         setDashStyle: function (element) { /* stub */ },
1435 
1436         /**
1437          * Puts an object into draft mode, i.e. it's visual appearance will be changed. For GEONE<sub>x</sub>T backwards
1438          * compatibility.
1439          * @param {JXG.GeometryElement} el Reference of the object that is in draft mode.
1440          */
1441         setDraft: function (el) {
1442             if (!Type.evaluate(el.visProp.draft)) {
1443                 return;
1444             }
1445             var draftColor = el.board.options.elements.draft.color,
1446                 draftOpacity = el.board.options.elements.draft.opacity;
1447 
1448             this.setObjectTransition(el);
1449             if (el.type === Const.OBJECT_TYPE_POLYGON) {
1450                 this.setObjectFillColor(el, draftColor, draftOpacity);
1451             } else {
1452                 if (el.elementClass === Const.OBJECT_CLASS_POINT) {
1453                     this.setObjectFillColor(el, draftColor, draftOpacity);
1454                 } else {
1455                     this.setObjectFillColor(el, 'none', 0);
1456                 }
1457                 this.setObjectStrokeColor(el, draftColor, draftOpacity);
1458                 this.setObjectStrokeWidth(el, el.board.options.elements.draft.strokeWidth);
1459             }
1460         },
1461 
1462         /**
1463          * Puts an object from draft mode back into normal mode.
1464          * @param {JXG.GeometryElement} el Reference of the object that no longer is in draft mode.
1465          */
1466         removeDraft: function (el) {
1467             this.setObjectTransition(el);
1468             if (el.type === Const.OBJECT_TYPE_POLYGON) {
1469                 this.setObjectFillColor(el,
1470                     el.visProp.fillcolor,
1471                     el.visProp.fillopacity);
1472             } else {
1473                 if (el.type === Const.OBJECT_CLASS_POINT) {
1474                     this.setObjectFillColor(el,
1475                         el.visProp.fillcolor,
1476                         el.visProp.fillopacity);
1477                 }
1478                 this.setObjectStrokeColor(el, el.visProp.strokecolor, el.visProp.strokeopacity);
1479                 this.setObjectStrokeWidth(el, el.visProp.strokewidth);
1480             }
1481         },
1482 
1483         /**
1484          * Sets up nodes for rendering a gradient fill.
1485          * @param element
1486          */
1487         setGradient: function (element) { /* stub */ },
1488 
1489         /**
1490          * Updates the gradient fill.
1491          * @param {JXG.GeometryElement} element An JSXGraph element with an area that can be filled.
1492          */
1493         updateGradient: function (element) { /* stub */ },
1494 
1495         /**
1496          * Sets the transition duration (in milliseconds) for fill color and stroke
1497          * color and opacity.
1498          * @param {JXG.GeometryElement} element Reference of the object that wants a
1499          *         new transition duration.
1500          * @param {Number} duration (Optional) duration in milliseconds. If not given,
1501          *        element.visProp.transitionDuration is taken. This is the default.
1502          */
1503         setObjectTransition: function (element, duration) { /* stub */ },
1504 
1505         /**
1506          * Sets an objects fill color.
1507          * @param {JXG.GeometryElement} element Reference of the object that wants a new fill color.
1508          * @param {String} color Color in a HTML/CSS compatible format. If you don't want any fill color at all, choose
1509          * 'none'.
1510          * @param {Number} opacity Opacity of the fill color. Must be between 0 and 1.
1511          */
1512         setObjectFillColor: function (element, color, opacity) { /* stub */ },
1513 
1514         /**
1515          * Changes an objects stroke color to the given color.
1516          * @param {JXG.GeometryElement} element Reference of the {@link JXG.GeometryElement} that gets a new stroke
1517          * color.
1518          * @param {String} color Color value in a HTML compatible format, e.g. <strong>#00ff00</strong> or
1519          * <strong>green</strong> for green.
1520          * @param {Number} opacity Opacity of the fill color. Must be between 0 and 1.
1521          */
1522         setObjectStrokeColor: function (element, color, opacity) { /* stub */ },
1523 
1524         /**
1525          * Sets an element's stroke width.
1526          * @param {JXG.GeometryElement} element Reference to the geometry element.
1527          * @param {Number} width The new stroke width to be assigned to the element.
1528          */
1529         setObjectStrokeWidth: function (element, width) { /* stub */ },
1530 
1531         /**
1532          * Sets the shadow properties to a geometry element. This method is only a stub, it is implemented in the actual
1533          * renderers.
1534          * @param {JXG.GeometryElement} element Reference to a geometry object, that should get a shadow
1535          */
1536         setShadow: function (element) { /* stub */ },
1537 
1538         /**
1539          * Highlights an object, i.e. changes the current colors of the object to its highlighting colors
1540          * and highlighting stroke width.
1541          * @param {JXG.GeometryElement} el Reference of the object that will be highlighted.
1542          * @returns {JXG.AbstractRenderer} Reference to the renderer
1543          * @see JXG.AbstractRenderer#updateTextStyle
1544          */
1545         highlight: function (el) {
1546             var i, ev = el.visProp,
1547                 sw, obj;
1548 
1549             this.setObjectTransition(el);
1550             if (!ev.draft) {
1551                 if (el.type === Const.OBJECT_TYPE_POLYGON) {
1552                     this.setObjectFillColor(el,
1553                         ev.highlightfillcolor,
1554                         ev.highlightfillopacity);
1555                     for (i = 0; i < el.borders.length; i++) {
1556                         this.setObjectStrokeColor(el.borders[i],
1557                             el.borders[i].visProp.highlightstrokecolor,
1558                             el.borders[i].visProp.highlightstrokeopacity);
1559                     }
1560                 } else {
1561                     if (el.elementClass === Const.OBJECT_CLASS_TEXT) {
1562                         this.updateTextStyle(el, true);
1563                     } else if (el.type === Const.OBJECT_TYPE_IMAGE) {
1564                         this.updateImageStyle(el, true);
1565                         this.setObjectFillColor(el,
1566                             ev.highlightfillcolor,
1567                             ev.highlightfillopacity);
1568                     } else {
1569                         this.setObjectStrokeColor(el, ev.highlightstrokecolor, ev.highlightstrokeopacity);
1570                         this.setObjectFillColor(el,
1571                             ev.highlightfillcolor,
1572                             ev.highlightfillopacity);
1573                     }
1574                 }
1575                 if (ev.highlightstrokewidth) {
1576                     sw = Math.max(Type.evaluate(ev.highlightstrokewidth), Type.evaluate(ev.strokewidth));
1577                     this.setObjectStrokeWidth(el, sw);
1578                     if (el.elementClass === Const.OBJECT_CLASS_LINE) {
1579                         obj = this.updateLineEndings(el, sw);
1580                         this.makeArrows(el);
1581                         this.updateArrowSize(el, obj);
1582                     }
1583                 }
1584             }
1585 
1586             return this;
1587         },
1588 
1589         /**
1590          * Uses the normal colors of an object, i.e. the opposite of {@link JXG.AbstractRenderer#highlight}.
1591          * @param {JXG.GeometryElement} el Reference of the object that will get its normal colors.
1592          * @returns {JXG.AbstractRenderer} Reference to the renderer
1593          * @see JXG.AbstractRenderer#updateTextStyle
1594          */
1595         noHighlight: function (el) {
1596             var i, ev = el.visProp,
1597                 obj, sw;
1598 
1599             this.setObjectTransition(el);
1600             if (!Type.evaluate(el.visProp.draft)) {
1601                 if (el.type === Const.OBJECT_TYPE_POLYGON) {
1602                     this.setObjectFillColor(el,
1603                         ev.fillcolor,
1604                         ev.fillopacity);
1605                     for (i = 0; i < el.borders.length; i++) {
1606                         this.setObjectStrokeColor(el.borders[i],
1607                             el.borders[i].visProp.strokecolor,
1608                             el.borders[i].visProp.strokeopacity);
1609                     }
1610                 } else {
1611                     if (el.elementClass === Const.OBJECT_CLASS_TEXT) {
1612                         this.updateTextStyle(el, false);
1613                     } else if (el.type === Const.OBJECT_TYPE_IMAGE) {
1614                         this.updateImageStyle(el, false);
1615                         this.setObjectFillColor(el,
1616                             ev.fillcolor,
1617                             ev.fillopacity);
1618                     } else {
1619                         this.setObjectStrokeColor(el,
1620                             ev.strokecolor,
1621                             ev.strokeopacity);
1622                         this.setObjectFillColor(el,
1623                             ev.fillcolor,
1624                             ev.fillopacity);
1625                     }
1626                 }
1627 
1628                 sw = Type.evaluate(ev.strokewidth);
1629                 this.setObjectStrokeWidth(el, sw);
1630                 if (el.elementClass === Const.OBJECT_CLASS_LINE) {
1631                     obj = this.updateLineEndings(el, sw);
1632                     this.makeArrows(el);
1633                     this.updateArrowSize(el, obj);
1634                 }
1635 
1636             }
1637 
1638             return this;
1639         },
1640 
1641         /* **************************
1642          * renderer control
1643          * **************************/
1644 
1645         /**
1646          * Stop redraw. This method is called before every update, so a non-vector-graphics based renderer can use this
1647          * method to delete the contents of the drawing panel. This is an abstract method every descendant renderer
1648          * should implement, if appropriate.
1649          * @see JXG.AbstractRenderer#unsuspendRedraw
1650          */
1651         suspendRedraw: function () { /* stub */ },
1652 
1653         /**
1654          * Restart redraw. This method is called after updating all the rendering node attributes.
1655          * @see JXG.AbstractRenderer#suspendRedraw
1656          */
1657         unsuspendRedraw: function () { /* stub */ },
1658 
1659         /**
1660          * The tiny zoom bar shown on the bottom of a board (if showNavigation on board creation is true).
1661          * @param {JXG.Board} board Reference to a JSXGraph board.
1662          * @param {Object} attr Attributes of the navigation bar
1663          *
1664          */
1665         drawZoomBar: function (board, attr) {
1666             var doc,
1667                 node,
1668                 cancelbubble = function (e) {
1669                     if (!e) {
1670                         e = window.event;
1671                     }
1672 
1673                     if (e.stopPropagation) {
1674                         // Non IE<=8
1675                         e.stopPropagation();
1676                     } else {
1677                         e.cancelBubble = true;
1678                     }
1679                 },
1680                 createButton = function (label, handler) {
1681                     var button;
1682 
1683                     button = doc.createElement('span');
1684                     node.appendChild(button);
1685                     button.appendChild(doc.createTextNode(label));
1686                     button.style.paddingLeft = '7px';
1687                     button.style.paddingRight = '7px';
1688 
1689                     Env.addEvent(button, 'mouseover', function () {
1690                         this.style.backgroundColor = attr.highlightfillcolor;
1691                     }, button);
1692                     Env.addEvent(button, 'mouseover', function () {
1693                         this.style.backgroundColor = attr.highlightfillcolor;
1694                     }, button);
1695                     Env.addEvent(button, 'mouseout', function () {
1696                         this.style.backgroundColor = attr.fillcolor;
1697                     }, button);
1698 
1699                     Env.addEvent(button, 'click', function(e) { (Type.bind(handler, board))(); return false; }, board);
1700                     // prevent the click from bubbling down to the board
1701                     Env.addEvent(button, 'mouseup', cancelbubble, board);
1702                     Env.addEvent(button, 'mousedown', cancelbubble, board);
1703                     Env.addEvent(button, 'touchend', cancelbubble, board);
1704                     Env.addEvent(button, 'touchstart', cancelbubble, board);
1705                 };
1706 
1707             if (Env.isBrowser && this.type !== 'no') {
1708                 doc = board.containerObj.ownerDocument;
1709                 node = doc.createElement('div');
1710 
1711                 node.setAttribute('id', board.containerObj.id + '_navigationbar');
1712 
1713                 node.style.color = attr.strokecolor;
1714                 node.style.backgroundColor = attr.fillcolor;
1715                 node.style.padding = attr.padding;
1716                 node.style.position = attr.position;
1717                 node.style.fontSize = attr.fontsize;
1718                 node.style.cursor = attr.cursor;
1719                 node.style.zIndex = attr.zindex;
1720                 board.containerObj.appendChild(node);
1721                 node.style.right = attr.right;
1722                 node.style.bottom = attr.bottom;
1723 
1724                 // For XHTML we need unicode instead of HTML entities
1725 
1726                 if (board.attr.showscreenshot) {
1727                     createButton(board.attr.screenshot.symbol, function () {
1728                         setTimeout(function() {
1729                             board.renderer.screenshot(board, '', false);
1730                         }, 330);
1731                     });
1732                 }
1733 
1734                 if (board.attr.showreload) {
1735                     // full reload circle: \u27F2
1736                     // the board.reload() method does not exist during the creation
1737                     // of this button. That's why this anonymous function wrapper is required.
1738                     createButton('\u21BB', function () {
1739                         board.reload();
1740                     });
1741                 }
1742 
1743                 if (board.attr.showcleartraces) {
1744                     // clear traces symbol (otimes): \u27F2
1745                     createButton('\u2297', function () {
1746                         board.clearTraces();
1747                     });
1748                 }
1749 
1750                 if (board.attr.shownavigation) {
1751                     if (board.attr.showzoom) {
1752                         createButton('\u2013', board.zoomOut);
1753                         createButton('o', board.zoom100);
1754                         createButton('+', board.zoomIn);
1755                     }
1756                     createButton('\u2190', board.clickLeftArrow);
1757                     createButton('\u2193', board.clickUpArrow);
1758                     createButton('\u2191', board.clickDownArrow);
1759                     createButton('\u2192', board.clickRightArrow);
1760                 }
1761             }
1762         },
1763 
1764         /**
1765          * Wrapper for getElementById for maybe other renderers which elements are not directly accessible by DOM
1766          * methods like document.getElementById().
1767          * @param {String} id Unique identifier for element.
1768          * @returns {Object} Reference to a JavaScript object. In case of SVG/VMLRenderer it's a reference to a SVG/VML
1769          * node.
1770          */
1771         getElementById: function (id) {
1772             if (Type.exists(this.container)) {
1773                 return this.container.ownerDocument.getElementById(this.container.id + '_' + id);
1774             }
1775             return '';
1776         },
1777 
1778         /**
1779          * Remove an element and provide a function that inserts it into its original position. This method
1780          * is taken from this article {@link https://developers.google.com/speed/articles/javascript-dom}.
1781          * @author KeeKim Heng, Google Web Developer
1782          * @param {Element} el The element to be temporarily removed
1783          * @returns {Function} A function that inserts the element into its original position
1784          */
1785         removeToInsertLater: function (el) {
1786             var parentNode = el.parentNode,
1787                 nextSibling = el.nextSibling;
1788 
1789             parentNode.removeChild(el);
1790 
1791             return function () {
1792                 if (nextSibling) {
1793                     parentNode.insertBefore(el, nextSibling);
1794                 } else {
1795                     parentNode.appendChild(el);
1796                 }
1797             };
1798         },
1799 
1800         /**
1801          * Resizes the rendering element
1802          * @param {Number} w New width
1803          * @param {Number} h New height
1804          */
1805         resize: function (w, h) { /* stub */},
1806 
1807         /**
1808          * Create crosshair elements (Fadenkreuz) for presentations.
1809          * @param {Number} n Number of crosshairs.
1810          */
1811         createTouchpoints: function (n) {},
1812 
1813         /**
1814          * Show a specific crosshair.
1815          * @param {Number} i Number of the crosshair to show
1816          */
1817         showTouchpoint: function (i) {},
1818 
1819         /**
1820          * Hide a specific crosshair.
1821          * @param {Number} i Number of the crosshair to show
1822          */
1823         hideTouchpoint: function (i) {},
1824 
1825         /**
1826          * Move a specific crosshair.
1827          * @param {Number} i Number of the crosshair to show
1828          * @param {Array} pos New positon in screen coordinates
1829          */
1830         updateTouchpoint: function (i, pos) {},
1831 
1832         /**
1833          * Convert SVG construction to canvas.
1834          * Only available on SVGRenderer.
1835          *
1836          * @see JXG.SVGRenderer#dumpToCanvas
1837          */
1838         dumpToCanvas: function(canvasId) {},
1839 
1840         /**
1841          * Display SVG image in html img-tag which enables
1842          * easy download for the user.
1843          *
1844          * See JXG.SVGRenderer#screenshot
1845          */
1846         screenshot: function(board) {}
1847 
1848     });
1849 
1850     return JXG.AbstractRenderer;
1851 });
1852
